topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556e44db6368725e539f1700#post_556e44db6368725e539f1700
[bq="trashboat"]*I agree with Uc9* on this topic.[/bq]
!http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2014/01/09/article-2535709-1A7D371000000578-703_964x531.jpg!
Joking aside; me personally I don't like the furry fandom and don't want to hang out at furry conventions or such cause I remember all the shit that used to go down back in the day, but I still consider myself a furry.  It's possible for someone to be a hobbyist in a fandom and not go to conventions or such.  Take my little pony for example; the vast majority of people in the brony fandom are hobbyists, they don't go to conventions or such and just think the show is cool and the art is cool, but they're still bronies.  It's possible for someone to like something without being a lifestyler.  To further the analogy not every trekkie has a star trek wedding or such.

You don't have to go to conventions or wear costumes that cost thousands of dollars if you think something is cool; it's possible to enjoy something and just chill out enjoying things you think are cool.
